main event: A civilian observed a bright star-like object moving erratically in the sky for approximately three hours on September 10, 1968, in Las Vegas, Nevada.
interesting points: The object was stationary at times but moved erratically back and forth, seemingly stopping briefly before darting in various directions., The witness described the object as having an intensity greater than that of the North Star and a blue-white color., The observation coincided with the visibility of Altair and Deneb in the night sky., Nellis Air Force Base personnel and North Las Vegas Airport reportedly also observed the same object., No physical evidence was recorded, and the sighting was deemed possibly an astronomical event.
witness description: Way Wies confirmed as the observer, who was cooperative and reliable.
